docs.snippet: Puerto Rico's House of Representatives on Tuesday debated a bill to halt debt payments, while a government official fired back at creditors who suggested the U.S. territory was shirking efforts to hold restructuring talks.
docs.lead_paragraph: Puerto Rico's House of Representatives on Tuesday debated a bill to halt debt payments, while a government official fired back at creditors who suggested the U.S. territory was shirking efforts to hold restructuring talks.

headline.main: Puerto Rico, Creditors Trade Barbs Over Debt Freeze Bill
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico, Creditors Trade Barbs Over Debt Freeze Bill

docs.snippet: Amazon.com Inc is set to release a higher-end Kindle version with a rechargeable protective case for a better battery life, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing a person familiar with the matter.

docs.snippet: A 9-year-old reporter who wrote about a suspected murder in her small Pennsylvania town is defending herself after some locals lashed out about a young girl covering violent crimes and said she should be playing with dolls.
docs.lead_paragraph: A 9-year-old reporter who wrote about a suspected murder in her small Pennsylvania town is defending herself after some locals lashed out about a young girl covering violent crimes and said she should be playing with dolls.

headline.main: 9-Year-Old Reporter Defends Homicide Coverage After Backlash
headline.print_headline: 9-Year-Old Reporter Defends Homicide Coverage After Backlash

docs.snippet: The U.S. Justice Department will file a lawsuit as soon as this week to stop oilfield services provider Halliburton Co from acquiring smaller rival Baker Hughes Inc, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Justice Department will file a lawsuit as soon as this week to stop oilfield services provider Halliburton Co from acquiring smaller rival Baker Hughes Inc, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

headline.main: U.S. Justice Dept Will Sue to Stop Halliburton, Baker Hughes Merger: Source
headline.print_headline: U.S. Justice Dept Will Sue to Stop Halliburton, Baker Hughes Merger: Source

docs.snippet: Drugmaker Pfizer Inc is leaning towards abandoning its $160 billion agreement to buy Allergan Plc in light of the U.S. Treasury's new measures to curb such tax evading deals, a source familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Drugmaker Pfizer Inc is leaning towards abandoning its $160 billion agreement to buy Allergan Plc in light of the U.S. Treasury's new measures to curb such tax evading deals, a source familiar with the situation said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Exclusive: Pfizer Leaning Towards Abandoning Deal With Allergan-Source
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Pfizer Leaning Towards Abandoning Deal With Allergan-Source

docs.snippet: Italy is considering setting up a state-backed fund that would help troubled lenders by buying up bad loans and plug capital shortfalls, three sources close to the matter said, as the government looks for ways to shore up its ailing banks.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy is considering setting up a state-backed fund that would help troubled lenders by buying up bad loans and plug capital shortfalls, three sources close to the matter said, as the government looks for ways to shore up its ailing banks.

headline.main: Italy Considers State-Backed Fund to Support Weak Banks-Sources
headline.print_headline: Italy Considers State-Backed Fund to Support Weak Banks-Sources

docs.snippet: Pakistan's Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif addressed the nation by television on Tuesday to defend his family's business practices, denying any wrongdoing and calling corruption claims "old accusations repeated over and over again".
